ground_truth.description: `_checkpoint` creates a new epoch with the same timestamp for `increase_amount`, ignoring the new lock in `balanceOfNFT`, reducing voting power.
ground_truth.root_cause: `_checkpoint` creates a new epoch with the same timestamp for `increase_amount`, ignoring the new lock in `balanceOfNFT`, reducing voting power.
ground_truth.attack_scenario: A test locks 500e18, increases by 500e18 in one tx, and shows reduced bribe rewards compared to separate locks.
ground_truth.fix_description: In `_checkpoint`, overwrite the latest point if timestamps match, else append a new one. Status: Mitigation confirmed.

prediction.overall_explanation: The contract implements a standard vote-escrow mechanism with extensions for permanent locks, merging, and splitting (authorized only). Core logic for checkpointing, balance decay, and delegation aligns with protocol intent. No exploitable vulnerabilities found: reentrancy guarded, transfers restricted when voted/attached, precision losses in splitting cause user dust loss only, permanent lock handling correctly updates global state without double-counting. Assumes trusted voter/team and correct VotingBalanceLogic library (not provided but usage consistent). Minor theoretical issues like checkpoint lag after years of inactivity are non-exploitable.
